channel.title: Labs on Tom Bishop
channel.description: Recent content in Labs on Tom Bishop

item.title: Highcharter Cookbook
item.description: Overview What When & Why Getting The Data Basic Charts Tidy Data Chart Types Treemap Maps Layering Elements Understanding The API A Simple Example Chart Data Conclusion Pre-Baked hchart() for different R classes Histograms Densities Character / Factor Counts Forecast Correlation Matrix Components + Style Grids + Facetting Axes Axes Transforms Unit Formatting Titles Chart Padding and Spacing Fonts Tooltip Plot Area Annotations Plot Lines and Bands Datalabels Advanced Labels Advanced Tooltips Nested Charts Dates + Datetimes Packaged Themes Custom Themes Harder Charts / Showcase Packed Bubble Donut Tooltip Animation Overview What highcharter is an R implementation of the highcharts javascript graphing API through R’s htmlwidgets.

item.title: Adding Interactivity to Static Rmarkdown Documents
item.description: Overview Adding interactivity to data analytics outputs is a great tool to have in your toolkit. As an R User you have a few major output formats to choose from. However, it’s not immediately obvious how much interactivity you can embed within each format.

item.title: Using Shinydashboard Elements in Shiny
item.description: Shinydashboard is built off the Bootstrap Admin LTE theme. It contains some cool elements (value/info boxes) that look pretty snazzy in a shiny dashboard. To use any of these elements (due to the differences in app creation syntax) within your regular shiny app you can’t just load the shinydashboard package. You’ll just need to grab a couple of CSS files from the shinydashboard package source code. Navigate to your [R Home]/library/shinydashboard/ and grab:

item.title: Bulletin Edition 1 with Source
item.description:
Nah but actually The Intern was ok.
Much analysis has been completed regarding the performing peak of athletes and sportspeople. Statistically, swimmers peak at around 24, marathon runners between 30-31, gymnasts at a mere 18, NBA players generally peak between 26-29, professional hockey players between 27-28, and chess players at 30-35.

item.title: R Markdown Test
item.description: Overview Hey. Just testing the Rmd funcitonality of this page. Maybe I’m interested in the BMI of human star wars characters. Maybe. Let’s see how this goes: library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) starwars %>% filter(species == "Human") %>% ggplot(aes(y=height, x=mass, colour=species)) + geom_point() + geom_smooth() + theme_bw() + ggtitle("Starwars BMI")
